paper_abstract: Based on the compression function of the hash function standard SHA-256, SHACAL-2 is a 64-round block cipher with a 256-bit block size and a variable length key of up to 512 bits. In this paper, we present a related-key rectangle attack on 42-round SHACAL-2, which requires 2(243.38) related-key chosen plaintexts and has a running time of 2(488.37). This is the best currently known attack on SHACAL-2.
